name: SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless for PC, PS5, and PS4 Headset

specs.Model: Arctis Nova Pro Wireless for PC, PS5, and PS4

comments: Best 'gaming' headphones I used to date. Only qualms I have on this is the subtle vibration it produce. Research says it's probably coming from its Active Noise Cancelling feature.

Is it possible to sound better than real life? These things manage to. They are amazing and I use them all the time. With the battery that lasts forever and another battery that's ready, that's a 15 second "charge" for 30 hours of battery life. The battery takes ~1 hour to charge in the GameDAC. Software is great and helps a lot. The best part is the functionality though. You can have 2 computers, 2 bluetooth devices, and an AUX device all playing audio through the headset at the same time with no issue. My setup is have it used with my computer, playing instant mic feedback, and connected to my phone if needed for a call, all playing at once.

Overall I really like this headset! I've used the Arctis line before and when I did I had one main issue. I would often start feeling pain in my head from wearing the headset too long, and because of that I was hesitant to get another Arctis headset. However having had some time with this new headset, I am very pleased to say that I have had 0 head pain (and minimal headphone hair). At times I even forget that they are on my head.
I like the design of the dock, though I would have preferred a little more weight to it to allow for easier use. However, the weight is still useable where it is.
One of the main issues I would hear about this headset was the audio drivers inside rubbing against ones own ear. I have experienced that specific issue but have noticed a possible solution (I have not fully tested it yet. I've found that when i feel it on my ear all I need to do is rest the ear cups higher on my ears and the problem is gone.
All in all, I feel that for the price tag there should be a few improvements. However I am still very pleased with the design!

Worth every penny imo. The bluetooth and battery charging in the base means it will basically never end up dead and I never miss notifications on my phone. Noise cancelling is amazing, so is the transparency mode. It's definitely not cheap, but it feels very premium and is definitely worth the money.
Perfection

NEVER DOWNLOAD STEELSERIES SOFTWARE OR UPDATE THE FIRMWARE.
I wish I could give these headphones 5 stars because the headphones themselves are perfect to me. However, SteelSeries and their customer service are nowhere deserving of even this 4 star review.
My original pair was bricked because of a firmware update. Neither the software or Windows would recognize it as a playback device anymore and there is no solution. On top of that, their customer service just does not care. I ordered a replacement through Amazon and marked mine as defective. I wiped everything SteelSeries from my PC before setting them up and will never touch their software again. This pair works just fine now.
(Coming from Logitech G Pro X Wireless, I will no longer use these - in fairness, great - headphones because of their poor build quality) I'm no audiophile, but these headphones sound great. They feel great on my head and the ANC is wonderful because I game in my bedroom, where my girlfriend also lives and games. On top of that, I sit right next to our standalone AC unit (13900KS, 4090, and 2080 Ti in one room moment) and when sitting at my desk listening to nothing I can very slightly hear the AC, but when I have any sound going through the headphones it's history. They feel great on my head and I enjoy using them.

For the price it was at on sale [~$40], these headphones were, and still are, incredible. Audio sounds really good, with some nice bass, great highs, and support for Spatial Sound/3D Audio/Whatever it's called. While it does support and work with it, it doesn't necessarily change much for the audio. It's pretty subtle, but I can't ask more, especially at this price point. The built in microphone is surprisingly good — it sounds clear without a crappy distorted effect. Only downside is that it sounds like you're a bit farther away from the mic and that it picks up more background audio, but nothing that ruins it. Latency with the USB stick is nonexistent, and latency via Bluetooth is pretty small. Not too much more than via the USB stick, just around a 10ms delay. Perfectly usable. Battery life is really good. It'll last ~6 - 7hrs on a full charge, and it takes ~ 30mins to get it back up and running. If you're looking for a nice headset, I highly recommend this.

So many details, so it's good for mixing. However, the high frequencies are boosted which bugs me a bit and can be tiring after a long session. I'd say the bass is flat and the mids are a bit down. Typical V-shaped tuned headphone.

Let's start with the most important things. These are 250 ohm open back headphones. By design they won't block out noise and they need at least a moderately powerful amp to drive them. Try to use them in a loud room or drive them with a standard headphone jack from a phone, laptop, or even the front panel I/O of most desktop computers and you'll be disappointed.
Use them in a quiet room with an amp that has the power to drive them and they're incredible.
"Mount Beyer" is definitely present - the brightness associated with most Beyerdynamic headphones is absolutely a thing, but to my ears this is only a problem if you're using an equalizer or other processor (like Creative's SBX sound processor). Use one of these and the brightness is almost piercing and uncomfortable. HOWEVER, if you turn off the equalizers and sound processors and drive the headphones directly, with audio that has no "surround effect" or "audio enhancers" applied, these are easily among the best sounding headphones I've ever experienced.
I think that the problem with things like Creative's SBX or other audio processors designed to "enhance" sound is that they almost invariably boost the same rage where these headphones already have fantastic response. Just use a flat EQ with no additional processing and let the headphones do their thing. You'll be glad you did. The soundstage is expansive and everything comes through beautifully - the sound from these is wonderfully detailed and clear. Well worth the cost of entry.
As far as comfort and other matters, the large ear cups rest comfortably without crushing your ears and the open back means they breathe well so they don't get hot. Even with glasses they don't get uncomfortable even after a long listening session.

The 250ohm version of this really needs to be connected to an amp so I added a Schiit stack to my build. These headphones are wonderful. I came from a wireless SteelSeries Arctis 7 and I just couldn't stand the popping and random disconnects anymore. A friend talked me into going with a real audio solution instead of defaulting to "gaming supplies" and it was the best decision I ever made. The open back profile of this headset is extremely immersive and makes everything you're playing feel like open world. I use these as my daily drivers for everything but music.
Awesome headphones for gaming and music listening. Pairs great with an Olympus 2-E10K Dac. Soundstage is super wide too which is ideal for gaming.

name: Logitech G733 Headset
comments:
I really like this headset but I'm taking off one star due to needing to have the Logitech G HUB app open at all times in order for the settings to stay in effect after the device is switched on and off.
I put off getting a proper headset for a long time because ones I had used before would always hurt my ears or feel like they were squeezing my head. This headset is comfortable for long periods of time. I like that it has softer fabric over the foam instead of that fake leather stuff that sticks to your skin and always ends up fraying.
The mic stick is detachable, and it is somewhat flexible allowing you to bend it to be closer to your mouth. I haven't heard how the mic sounds on the other end myself- I wouldn't expect a headset mic to be amazing but at least I don't have to yell for my friends to hear me in discord, and that is all I need.
I'm not super picky about sound quality but I can tell that the headset is a step up from my wireless earbuds, and it has just enough sound canceling to improve my gaming experience without making me completely deaf to what is going on around me.
If you want the two RGB areas to cycle through the rainbow while showing different colors like the headset does out of the box, you will need to set them to separate rates of change in G HUB, otherwise the color will sync. I personally do not notice the lights in my peripheral vision unless I turn off all the lights in the room besides my headset and monitor. I don't care much about the lights though, the reason I chose this headset was for comfort and the lights are just a bonus feature. I like that they turn red to indicate the battery is low, but you can also check the battery level by lightly tapping the power button.
It may be worth noting that my head is smaller than average, so folks with larger heads than mine might be less comfortable than I am. Also, I saw another review here where the person said they could hear the signal of the device communicating with their computer for RGB changes, but that has not been an issue for me and I have pretty sensitive hearing (I can hear high pitched noises from certain electronics that others can't hear) but it may be something to be mindful of if you are SUPER sensitive.
The GOAT headset. 30 hours of battery (RGB off), no head ache from long use and amazing sound. 11/10

I must say this headset is great, it's so comfortable, it has a high quality of wireless connection, and it's really easy to use. The software however, is absolute trash. If you plan on the headset's RGB, don't bother. It will beep in your brain endlessly. This headset doesn't have builtin memory, and so it transfers a frequency for each setting, and you can hear that. It's terrible. Just turn off the RGB. Aside from that, it's really comfortable. Luckily I don't care for RGB, but it is pretty annoying in Linux that I have to use stuff like OpenRGB to turn it off. Also you must turn off the headset in order to have the RGB off if the PC is off (which is an advantage imo)
Great headset not much to say but if you where glasses this is for you
Super duper comfortable and doesn't have any of that fake leather that withers over time. Has this nice weave and elastic head band that feels amazing. 10/10.

These are beautiful, comfortable, sound great, and the microphone is awesome. Voice feedback when the mic and/or voice feedback is on or off is very handy. Once you get the settings tweaked they sound amazing, some of the best sounding headphones I've had.

I had a SteelSeries Siberia 800. Used it for about 2 years. Problem was the rotating part of the left earcup broke, as it was only made out of plastic. Tried to fix it with superglue, didn't work. I hear loud static unless I fiddle with that broken part.
So I was looking for a new SteelSeries headset, but they're all sold out from the sellers I trust. Then I found out about the Corsair Virtuoso from Linus Tech Tips and Hardware Canucks.
Aluminum frame is pretty sturdy. But just like the Youtubers say, it's too tight. Then again, if my experience with my Siberia 800 were any indication, give it about 3 weeks at least, and the headband should loosen up.
The sound is alright, after tweaking the equalizer from Corsair iCUE software. Corsair's virtual surround sound is weird for music, but in games it did surprisingly well. I was playing Prey (2017) prior to getting these headphones, and now with them on, even if I can't see some flying robot, I could tell when it was flying above me. I could tell when it was closing in and when it was directly above my head. The sensation felt so real that the first time it happened, it made me instinctively duck my head a bit in real life.
If you play a lot of FPS games, consider checking out these headphones (or just headphones with virtual surround in general, if you don't like Corsair) as the ability to tell when a sound is above or below you helps a lot.
A few problems:
Mic may not work in wired mode if you connect the USB from a USB hub. Best to connect it directly to your PC's back/front USB port. This is a common problem with devices connected to a USB hub as the hub typically only has one USB port's worth of power, so it can't give enough juice if you connect too many power hungry devices.
Wireless signal interference can happen. I turned on my Joycons wirelessly and while it was pairing, the music I was listening to stuttered, and I hear a short crackling/static sound. Supposedly, Corsair's "Slipstream" wireless dongle automatically switches to a less used frequency to give it the best possible connection, so maybe it will take time for it to do so the more you turn on wireless devices in your room.
If you have near 100% RAM usage, it starts to stutter (then again, everything in your PC will slow down with 100% RAM usage).

Superb Headset, sound is fantastic and the mic also sound great and does it job.
This is the best headset I've ever had.

Recommended!

name: Beyerdynamic DT1990 Pro Headphones
comments: All other headphones sound terrible after experiencing these, but they will crush your skull until either you or them develop some give

Holly crap, the clarity. I've heard things, that I haven't heard before with these headphones. Could be a deal breaker for some, as I've heard the imperfections in a couple recordings. IE The Daft Punk Random Access Memory album.

This is my first "audiophile" grade headphones and they are superb! I'm mostly a movie buff, but I also enjoy music. While my Sennheiser 598 HD's have been great for gaming, movies and music for the last 2 years, the music was meh. After countless hours reading and watching reviews of different DAC/Amps and headphones that would be great for both music and gaming, I found these, recommended by most sites, but especially Zeos.
I cannot find a fault with these headphones. The craftsmanship is superb (German made) and the sound is stellar. They are comfortable to wear for extended periods of time and are very sturdy. I wouldn't worry if they dropped on the floor. They feel that solid. They come with two sets of pads. I switched out the Balanced pair and attached the Analytical pair due to more softness and sound presentation. Paired with a good DAC/Amp ( I use The Element), they have been a real joy to listen to.
When I bought them from the Musician's Friend online store they were taking forever to ship, I had paid for them with PayPal so I couldn't figure out why. I made a big mistake when I bought these. I had never ordered from Musician's Friend before and I forgot to check the reviews on them before I made the purchase. I got on the Reseller Ratings website and looked them up and I was like "Uh Oh" they have a 1 out of 10 review rating. I thought "damn I'm going to get burned on this purchase", but low and behold they finally shipped and then a few days later I received them. I was like "Whew!".
Bought a custom cable for them too at Mimic Cables

name: Corsair HS80 RGB Headset
comments: Great sound and is super comfortable. Lights adjustable on the iCue app, if that's your thing. The microphone is crisp and haven't heard any complaints from my buddies. Was gifted from a coworker and a major upgrade from the Steel Series Arctic 3 wired I was using forever.

This headset seems to be fairly decent. I got these in March and updated them as soon as I got them with the iCUE software. The battery life is a little less than expected. As long as you remember to charge it after every couple of uses your golden. There is not an accurate battery level indicator to know what the charge is. The icon in iCUE is basically fully charged, half charged, and low battery. The range is not as far is indicated either. I get 15 feet away into my hallway in my single family home and it cuts out entirely. This is likely attributed to having the dongle plugged into the pc on the back of the PC instead of the single top port of the PC, and other wireless traffic in the area.
I got my wife the HS80 Max, which has almost triple the battery life, and can get to our back porch (about 50 feet through wood studs and drywall.
Overall a 4 out of 5. Battery and lower than expected range is my reason.
Very comfortable, although can have a little bit of squeezing

This headset is something I actually did consider returning. Right out of the box the sound is just awful. It's flat, tinny and just doesn't have any depth to it. I was further worried by this still being the case when turning on Dolby Atmos. I do think that the Corsair Void headsets have better surround sound quality overall, but after some major tweaking of EQ's and getting used to a different sounding pair of headphones, I did finally find a spot where I am happy with them. The major reason I kept on to these is that they are not as high profile as the Void series and the mic quality is actually pretty nuts for a gaming headset. You'd be forgiven for mistaking it for a standalone mic with how good it sounds. The wireless part is new to me and I really appreciate the freedom it gives, the lack of wire is worth paying for if you're not a complete sound buff who needs something like a studio headset. The distance on these things isn't great but it reaches 90% of our small rented space, I lose connection when I am at the edge of the kitchen and in the downstairs bathroom, so not awful. I do see this being a bigger issue in a full sized house. The wireless charge with lights on lasts me about 18 hours so I tend to have them on charge before they run out. Though I do take care not to leave them charging overnight as to avoid damaging the battery life.
Overall probably not the best option out there, but certainly not the worst and I am finding myself becoming happier with them the longer I use them.
Edit: So it is currently June 6th 2023 and I bought these on November 28th 2022. The earpads have already fallen apart, I've requested some more via the 2 year warranty but this really brings the rating down to a 3 star. The build quality of the cups is appalling for the price.

name: Razer BlackShark V2 Pro (2023) Headset
comments: Great headset, but not happy with the microphone; it doesn't work (likely a malfunction). Still using my Logitech Yeti X microphone.

These sound incredible. I wanted the Cloud Alpha, but got the Cloud 2 on sale. I'm glad I didn't spend the extra. The cord is super long, and the controls are simple to use. They are extremely comfortable and don't feel cheap at all.
the sound is good but I have problem with The sound is distorted, I have to disable it and enable its so annoying

comments: I never thought some entry level audiophile headset could beat 90% of gaming oriented headphones, but here we are, and I am completely happy with this purchase. Great sounding headphones but I wish they had more clamping pressure.

Way better than any gaming headset you could buy, and for the price with a v-moda microphone you'd have to spend at least $200 to get a comparable gaming headset. I've had it for 3 years and the only issue I've had was with the v-moda going kinda f*cky and playing static in one ear at certain volume levels, which was a $15 fix, and besides that the headband broke a small amount after around 2.5 years (was a quick temporary fix with hot glue), but I didn't expect this headset to last as long as it did, and for the price I'm surprised it lasted as long as it did. No wear on the ear cups or anywhere else. It's very comfortable and light, good swivel, enough headband adjustment, etc. The biggest problem for some people would be it's open back so if you live in a loud house or in a big city with trains and **** (or a loud keyboard) it could be a problem. Definitely worth it if you don't expect it to last forever

Excellent pair of cans, especially when price is taken into consideration. I used to use a pair of beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro. After using open back headphones I don’t think I could go back to closed back for use in a private setting. The SHP9500s are so damn comfortable. They have great neutral sound reproduction and solid imaging. Soon after getting them I gifted the DT 770s to my pops.
Fantastically flat. Little dull at the top end for my tastes, but for 70 dollars I can't really complain.
This with a V-Moda boom mic is my headset of choice, cost me about 110 USD for similar performance in a gaming headset I would have to pay close to 250-300 USD.

Amazing. They sound great, they're built sturdy, they're as comfortable as you can get, and they're open backs. A steal at $70. Perhaps the most attractive feature, however, is the removable cable, which lets you pair them with the V-MODA BoomPro. Together, they become a $110 headset that singlehandedly champions the argument that you should not buy a gaming headset when the SHP9500 + BoomPro combo exists.

Been rocking these for a few years now. I paired it with a FOSI Audio DAC-Q4 just to give me more control over base and treble. For 70 dollars you honestly cant beat these, especially for music and content consumption!
Best price to performance headphones on the market. The open back design is great. And the minimal clamping force is really nice.

Have used it extensively for 1.5years at this point and the battery still lasts >12h.

I don't have much to say, but overall: Sony is an amazing brand for audio quality. Excellent noise cancelling. 5 Stars.

The sound! oh man the sound! amazing product.

really good just need some eq tuning to sound super good

name: SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless for Xbox X|S, and Xbox One Headset

specs.Model: Arctis Nova Pro Wireless for Xbox X|S, and Xbox One

comments:
Pros: Great headset, chat mix is useful, Sonar has built-in streamer mixing. I get compliments on my mic quality. The hot-swappable batteries might make the headset worth buying for that alone. In general, the hardware is top tier (with the exception of the ear cups).
Cons: Sonar/SteelSeries GG has to be running for the headset to work properly, and I swear it resets my settings every few days. It's maddening. The app has good features, but once I set things up I don't want to have to think about your stupid app and/or change my settings back every time I want to use the headset. Stop shuffling my device switching settings. Stop crashing when I use my KVM switch and killing the sound to my desktop. SteelSeries, for the love of god fix your app, or make it optional. There's a whole DAC sitting on my desk doing nothing that could be doing a lot of this stuff without forcing me to interact with your software.
Also, the noise-canceling is mid, and I eventually had to switch out the earcups for Wicked Cushions because the stock ones were getting pretty uncomfortable. Unfortunately, I think this did change the sound profile a bit.
A little tight on the head, but SteelSeries does it again.

Very light and comfortable even for long sessions, and the battery lasts for a very long time as well. The included microphone is passable, and the range with the dongle is great alongside the option for a wired connection.
Still working up to this day. Definitely worth the buy.
Love it. Very comfortable and battery lasts all day. I did replace the earcups with leather ones and it feels even nicer
Very good budget headset. Super comfortable. The microphone sounds decent.
Absolutely in love.

name: Razer Kraken Kitty Headset
comments: Got it for the lols, used about 1 year sofar. Decent sound and mic quality, rgb lithing is dope. One issue though is that while connected via usb (the only way to connect it to the pc), it prevents pc from going to sleep even after disabling everything that would prevent PC from sleeping. Feel free to comment below if anyone knows a fix.

name: Logitech ASTRO A10 Headset
comments: Good microphone and sound quality for $79CAD. However, the volume scroll wheel is a bit finicky after a few years of use. I need to turn it to the perfect spot for the sound to come from both ears at the same clarity and volume level and still be loud enough.
W sound

name: Turtle Beach EAR FORCE Recon 50X Headset
comments: Haven't used it much but the audio sounds really good for its price. The mic is a bit quiet tho.
Sound is ok but it's not that comfortable after a while.
Good headset, nice sound, but I lost the little foam piece on the mic

name: Sennheiser HD 650 Headphones

specs.Features:
Top-of-the-range open, dynamic hi-fi stereo headphones
Systems with narrow tolerances (+/- 1 dB), hand-picked in pairs
High-quality titanium/silver finish
Specially developed acoustic silk for precise, uniform attenuation over the entire area
Specially modulated connecting cable (detachable) made from highly conductive OFC copper, Kevlar-reinforced, with very low handling noise, i.e. low structure-borne sound sensitivity
Extremely lightweight aluminum voice coils ensure excellent transient response
Exceptionally comfortable to wear due to elliptical design adapted to the shape of the ears
Can be directly connected to stationary hi-fi components of the highest quality, in particular SACD, DVD-A and CD players.

comments:
Comfortable, build well, and last long. Intimate staging but endgame tonality and timbre. HD580, 600 and 650 blow any other dynamic open back out of the water, except maybe stuff like ZMF and maybe the Auroris Borealis.
Definitely way better than treble death headphones like dt770/990/1990/1770. those are very yucky.
Same caliber as HD600, and HD580. (And only those specific models)

I'm actually using the HD-6XX from Drop, but they're identical so I put it under this because that pair isn't on here. Very good, sound is amazing, just the right level of everything. There's a reason this is the benchmark pair for headphones, and the audiophile headphone for beginners. It's easy to decide with its balanced and detailed soundscape if you want more treble/bass/etc, and to upgrade to according intermediate open-back pairs like the Sundaras or Beyerdynamic DT-990/1990 pros. For me, though, the balance was just perfect, and I don't plan on changing these out for many years. Just get an amp along with them. I went with the FiiO K7. These are also still mindblowing how good they are to me, as I went from a Razer Kraken headset to these lol. I used to like those things but they sound like absolute crap now.
Like God whispering directly in your ears.

sound incredible; pairs v. nicley with my schiit magni (modi otw). basses are nice and punchy, highs and mids are clear. no overpowering trebble like other options at a similar price (dt990s)
super comfy with incredible build quality and a fantastic upgrade from my ath m50x's
Love these, the sound quality is immaculate.
Very good reference sound with an O2 headphone amp I built from a kit.
I guess these are good? I'm not really much of an audiophile, so I can't really tell. They are comfortable to wear for long periods of time.

These aren't genuine HD 650's, but the only difference is cosmetic. They're built in the same factory, using the same parts, but with different colors and a Massdrop logo. I've got a Modmic attached for gaming. Best $200 you can spend on a set of cans.

I came from a pair of HD598s to these, wanting something better for listening to music with while retaining the 598s for gaming. These really do live up to the hype surrounding them. Just make sure you have a dedicated amp to drive them properly.
I should note that I bought mine heavily used and they're so well built that you could have told me they were new and I'd have believed it.

name: Sony XM5 Headset
comments: XM4s aren't listed, but that's what I have. Basically the same. Expensive, but worth it. Great noise isolation.

name: Astro A50 + Base Station Headset
comments: I'm not sure if they are worth it at 300. Ive had issues with connectivity and the band on top that cushions the head

Love the headset, It is incredibly comfortable and has amazing sound. On the docking station, the battery fully charges in 4-6 hours and will last me easily 3-4 days of 9+ hours of gaming sessions. My only gripes are the charging port is on the right ear, and I feel like my charger is always on the left, so it has to cross my body if I want to wear it while charging. Also, for the price, I would like it to be able to Bluetooth to my phone so I don't have to take it off every time I need to answer the phone.

name: Turtle Beach Stealth 700 Gen 2 MAX 5.1 Channel Headset
comments: VERY comfy around my ears. great sound

name: Sennheiser HD600 Headphones

specs.Features:
High-quality open metal mesh earpiece covers for an extremely transparent sound
Computer optimized magnet systems minimize harmonic and intermodulation distortion
Extremely lightweight aluminum voice coils ensure excellent transient response
Neodymium ferrous magnet systems ensure optimum sensitivity and an excellent dynamic response
Exceptionally natural, spatial and accurate sound
Detachable, Kevlar reinforced, OFC copper cable
Award winning accessory of the year

comments: I could hear footsteps in the game tomorrow.
Big fan of the overall neutral sound
i love these things, they blow all my target headphones out of the water. works amazing with gaming too!
Get this and a standalone mic youll never look back.
Extremely happy with these headphones. I'm not qualified to really give a useful opinion/review of audio equipment so I'll leave it at that.

The HD560s(which i had before my hd600) were better.
At the price of the HD600 its more worth it if you got an Audio Technica ATH-R70X. altho that one will benefit greatly from a good amp.
The 600 series from Sennheiser has no place in the modern market as it is right now. These were barely better then my cheaper Moondrop Blessing 2 IEMs and those are more pleasant to listen to.
These will change the type of music you listen to just due to the pure fidelity.
The best headphones I've ever owned. The sound quality is crisp, clear, and beautiful. From music, to games, to movies. These are absolutely stunning headphones.
These are amazing for the price.
Best $300 headphone along with the HD 650. Needs quality headphone amplifier and dac.

name: Beyerdynamic DT 1770 PRO Headphones
comments: I'm a basshead, really like the sound of the Beyerdynamic signature.

Amazing sounding headphones. I personally like the closed design and bass cannon since I listen a lot of Bass headed music. Use the velour pads nowadays since they give a bit more balance. With pleather pads it's a bit too much bass.

Excellent studio-grade headphones. I had a set of Audeze XC's ($1800) that I won in a competition back in 2014. One of the drivers gave out on it, which is absurd considering the price. I wasn't keen on spending another grand plus for headphones, did some research and will admit these were a worthy replacement for a 3rd of the price. I use Sonarworks SoundID to flatten them.
Yup it's expensive "IF U DON'T TRY IT" I don't always feel it, I forget that I wear it !
amazing sound stage and imaging for a pair of closed back headphones, but I had to throw a pair of DT770 pads on these, as the stock pads, just didn't sound good.

name: Logitech G935 7.1 Channel Headset
comments: I threw them at my desk and snapped one of the sides off and they still work and I can use them still.
They sound great, they look great, and they're super comfortable. Would have liked to have USB-C charging, though.

These headphones are incredible. The RGB looks nice and pairs well with other Logitech device for a very sharp, clean look. The battery is replaceable for amazing longevity. The headphones are retractable and sound very good for a headphone mic. Has a pass-through audio so you can hear yourself better when wearing them as they damn near eliminate any other noise with their incredible noise cancelling ear muffs. The pass-through noise can be turned on and off thought the Logitech app and also stops when mic is muted to easily know if your mic is on or not. The 7.1 surround sounds incredible and is super easy to tell which direction the sound is coming from.

Yea I know , Logitech again, what can I say they make good products. The customer service I have had from the company is awesome as well. I was trying to find someone selling the side magnetic covers as I wanted to get another set so I could modify mine, and I couldn't find them anywhere for sale. I contacted Logitech and to my surprise they informed me that they are not sold separately. But wait for it, ....In the mail not even a week later, Logitech had sent me a set of the magnetic covers and a spare battery as well ....For FREE.....wow, how many companies do stuff like that!!
These fit my head great, I have a larger head and a lot of headsets out there are just too small! They sound great, I don't get sweaty with them on , even for hours. Just very good and comfortable! been using these for about 5-6 months as well

name: JBL Quantum 100 Headset
comments: Decent sound quality and mic quality.

name: DROP Drop + Sennheiser PC38X Headset
comments: Cheapest audiophile level headset I could find at least in my research and has given me a lifechanging experience in gaming. I am never going back to wireless gaming headsets.

Great value, you can expect rapidly diminishing returns by going more expensive than these headphones. Comes with a decent quality microphone as well.
I just wish they were a bit louder, I generally have to turn the volume slider on these higher than the Logitech Pro X's they replaced. I doubt volume will be a concern for the vast majority of listeners however.
Great headset, amazing soundstage. Only wish the microphone was detachable.

Awesome sound, crisp and good base. The shape of the earmuffs are big and fit nicely around my ears. Even with my big head, the clamp force isn't annoying, the adjustment notches are strong and won't come lose, extra-long cable, great microphone, I love the mute mic feature. The construction feels a little chintzy, maybe because I came from a metal pair of headphones, but in reality, they still are a great set of headphones if you take care of them. I am looking forward to upgrading to a HD600.
Amazing for the price!
The plastic build is not the best but the audio quality is top notch.

name: Beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO X Limited Edition Headphones
Razer Kraken V3 Pro 7.1 Channel Headset
comments:
Love these headphones, I don't use the haptic feedback as often anymore, as I prefer to keep them plugged into AUX, instead of charging them every night. Also, I have a pair of Google Pixel Buds Pro, which are easier to just put in my ears and go. I mainly use these when I'm in VR, as they feel pretty immersive!
[UPDATE 2024: These headphones came in clutch during 2023. I played VR often, so having good audio was very important to me. The mic sucks bad on the headphones if you're using AUX (I believe they're more reliable using Wireless USB), so I recommend getting an external mic. If that's out of your budget, you can literally just use your phone :)]

name: Beyerdynamic MMX 300 (2nd Generation) Headset
comments: Almost Perfect Analog Headset, Superb Audio Quality, Durable Earpads. its Microphone gain is too low, which creates a noisy Mic Output paired with Budget Motherboards.

Awesome pair of closed back headphones with a fantastic microphone. Sounds especially good for music and movies. The spacious sound that you might chase for gaming would be better on an open-back headset, but they still might be the best closed-back gaming headset I've ever heard.
I give them 4 stars because the included ear cushions don't feel premium and are much too firm for my liking. If you can pick up some softer replacements such as Dekoni pads, the comfort and bass response are both improved.

Used to have an HD 569 and an antlion modmic as a headset setup but I wanted a dedicated headset and this one fit my needs, it sounds very good albeit with post EQ tuning.
Ordered: Dec 26, 2023
Arrived: Dec 28, 2023
great sound and mic
Incredible sound quality and every time I hop into a discord channel, people comment on how much better this mic sounds than my previous HyperX cloud IIs.

name: Razer BlackShark V2 Headset
comments: I think we have been through 3 or 4 of these. They lasted for about two years each until they get damaged, lost or thrown under a bus. Pretty good headset and will last much longer if you look after them.

Great headphones but I would replace the earcups asap if I were you. I bought some fluffy ones from amazon and they feel much nicer and don't use the crappy Pleather which Razer uses. Seriously, Razer please stop using P Leather that stuff just wears away in a couple months.
You buy these for gaming. It will bring you the most enjoyable and clearest gaming experience.
Sounds absoluoteley amazing with the little sound card and the mic is clean too

For the price? Absolutely a steal. The sound seems balanced, and if its not, you have a USB soundcard with an equalizer. Amazing. The mic is also superb. Using it for my stream and it does'nt dissapoint.
Holy heck, if you can get this for anything less than the sale price, immediately get it. Nice design, great sound (THX Spatial too!), and support for both USB and analog connections.

per research, razer is amongst the best
figure, asus, amd, seagate, etc. all have a purpose, here's razer's
pc accessories
Very good directional sound, only problem is my usb sound card that came with it made the sound quality really bad. But it doesn't affect me because I plug it into my Wave 3.
Crisp and comfortable. I got the special edition for the Case and green accents and it is amazing!
I dont think you can get a headset of this quality at this price anywhere else, 10/10.

name: Logitech G PRO Headset
comments: Nice headset but kind of bad mic.

Pretty nice headset for the money. Got them for 50$ and this feels like a really nice 75$ headset but never in a million years would I pay 100$ for this, which is what I see a lot of retailers selling it for. The mic definitely feels like a 60$ headset mic so if you buy this with the intent of getting a mic to stream on Twitch with I think there are better options for less but when it comes to gaming this thing feels amazing. I love the look and feel and it is one of the first headsets that can properly fit on my head since I have an afro. Because of the detachable mic, this can easily be worn in public to listen to music with and nobody would guess it's a gaming headset which is a definite plus, just be warned the cable is mega long so I wouldn't exactly recommend that unless you have some sort of thing to store the extra cable in. Overall, definitely worth the 50$ I spent on it, wouldn't go more than 70$ though.
Very good sound, not a very good mic. I got it for 40€, lucky me, very good deal.
Good sound quality at an affordable price.

name: Corsair Virtuoso RGB 7.1 Channel Headset
comments: Great sound (after adjusting EQ). Mic is also very good when considering that it is a wireless headset. The only issue I have with it is that it has audio crackling on some movies and shows when watched with MPV player. This is a problem because Plex uses this player. There are 2 workarounds: Connect headset with 3.5mm cable or route the audio through voicemeeter.

These are a pretty decent set of headphones, albeit a bit pricey for what you get, they do not have bluetooth support, and use a proprietary wireless connection called slipstream, which connects via a USB dongle. Mic quality is good, but mic and sound quality in general is better across the board when used in wired mode. Petty grievances aside, they look very nice and fit my head comfortably, so overall I enjoy them, but wish I would have bought them on sale.
They are comfortable and the sound is great
Great headphone! Amazing sounds, only issue is it keeps cutting in and out randomly haven’t found out how to fix until then 3* .

Needed audio tune to sound good, I used the one mentioned in LTT's wireless headphone comparison video. range is mediocre. recently, I encountered a glitch where the audio/mic would start glitching and sounding robotic, that could sometimes be fixed by a restart of the headphones. Yesterday, it also started connecting, disconecting, and reconecting in a cycle, but it seems to have fixed itself. idk whats going on. On further examination I have discovered that it stops working when the mic is being used by an aplication.
cant complain pros: sounds great, charge lasts for a couple extended sessions, mute mic button is in a great spot cons: on the heavier side, could be an issue after 8+ hours

name: HiFiMAN SUNDARA Headphones
comments: (2021 model) Nice.

For the price-point, I really cannot recommend these highly enough. The sound quality on music and games is just ridiculously clean. They're pretty comfy on the head too. The sound is a bit more metallic than I was used to initially, but after EQing and more use, this eased.
They are open-back, so you can hear a fair bit of ambient noise, and others can hear what you're listening to. Just be aware of that fact.
UPDATE after 2 years: These are still the best headphones I've ever owned. They do sound even better with an amp.

name: SteelSeries Arctis Nova 3 Headset
comments: Great sound quality and you get a choice of connection type between usb-c and standard audio jack. They also feel incredibly light to wear, after a while you'll forget they're even there.
Picked these up at Best Buy, One of the most comfortable headsets I have worn.

name: Asus TUF Gaming H1 Wireless 7.1 Channel Headset
Astro Gaming A40 TR + MixAmp Pro TR 7.1 Channel Headset

specs.Model: Gaming A40 TR + MixAmp Pro TR

comments: Astro headphones for the win or at least that's what my brother told me when i gave them to him.
The absolute best headset that I have ever owned. I have the soundproof kit with it and hear everything in my games or video or music even clearer.

name: SteelSeries ARCTIS 7 2019 Edition 7.1 Channel Headset
comments: Got these for Christmas in 2022, Have not disappointed me once

Great headset, been rocking this for a few years. Mic and sound quality are great, only complaint is the driver grill touches my ears a little bit, I do wish there was just a little more room for my big ears in there.

From my previous setup. These have been amazing wireless headphones. Super comfortable and they sound great. Plus the range is really good in case you need to hear your game while you make a sandwich. After about 2 years of ownership, ive started having issues with discord and the surround sound, may be a software issure but I've not found a fix for these issues. Physical condition is great even after about 3 years. Also when they are at low battery they play a tone every 30 seconds or so until you plug them in, it gets very annoying when you cant plug them in.
bought used on amazon warehouse, everyone said they were garbage, but these produce highest quality sound ive ever heard. the mic is meh, but dont think you can get much better on a gaming headset
Best wireless headset on the market, no contest.
Took a while to get used to, love them now.

Good audio quality. Comfortable once you replace the ear pads with thicker ones. Excellent battery life. Mic sounds decent and retracts into the headset. Main thing I'm looking forward to is USB Type C update and an update to make the USB receiver more compact or at least detachable from the USB cable.
Good steeleries quality audio. I have been told the mic is bassy, which can be solved by moving the mic away from the mouth and nose so that you aren’t blowing directly on it.
amazing sound, the mic is according to my friends "good". The headset also last for a long time with out charging, and when you charge it it goes fast.
These are a revelation. Sound quality is fantastic... AFTER you set it up properly. I firmly suspect these things are capable of much more than the software they are shipped with will allow
